intro: Mesembryanthemum productum, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick stems and leaves. It produces a profusion of pale blue or white flowers during the cooler months. Mesembryanthemum productum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
